alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Cleburne; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Jefferson; Johnson County Higher Elevations; Lincoln; Lonoke; Marion; Newton County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations; Northwest Searcy County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Searcy County Lower Elevations; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations; White (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 18 at 2:18PM CDT until August 19 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT: Expect heat index values to peak near or just over 105. * WHERE: Pike, Clark, Ouachita, Calhoun, Bradley, Drew, Polk County Lower Elevations, Northern Polk County Higher Elevations, Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations and Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations Counties. * WHEN: From 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS: Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
